title: Area of region from the graph of the derivative

content.question: The graph of the function f shown above consists of two line segments. If g is the function defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4460@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, then <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B56@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
